events.title: Abraham Lincoln Elected 16th President of the United States
events.description: Abraham Lincoln wins the U.S. presidential election, becoming the first Republican president. His election was a catalyst for the secession of Southern states, leading up to the American Civil War.
events.significance: Marked a turning point in American history, leading to the preservation of the Union and the abolition of slavery.

events.title: First Daylight Saving Time Implemented in the United States
events.description: The United States implements daylight saving time for the first time as a way to conserve energy during World War I.
events.significance: Introduced a major change in timekeeping across the country, influencing daily life and energy consumption patterns.

events.title: Pervez Musharraf Leads Military Coup in Pakistan
events.description: General Pervez Musharraf seizes power in Pakistan through a military coup, overthrowing the civilian government of Nawaz Sharif.
events.significance: Marked a significant shift in Pakistan's governance, impacting its domestic policies and international relations.

events.title: Formation of the First West African Country- Liberia Declared a Republic
events.description: Liberia, established by freed American slaves, officially declares itself a republic with its own constitution.
events.significance: Signifies an important development in African self-governance and the history of freed African Americans.
